intro: Cestrum laevigatum var. puberulum, commonly known as the hairy cestrum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its smooth, often hairy stems and dark green, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late summer to early autumn. It is a deciduous shrub that can grow up to 3 meters tall, often cultivated for its ornamental value and night-blooming fragrance. The fruit is a small, capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
